comment: Smart Data Models - EquivalentInjection adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/EquivalentInjection/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. This class represents equivalent injections (generation or load).  Voltage regulation is allowed only at the point of connection.

contents.name: ReactiveCapabilityCurve
contents.comment: The equivalent injection using this reactive capability curve. Default: None

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: maxP
contents.comment: Maximum active power of the injection. Default: 0.0

contents.name: maxQ
contents.comment: Used for modeling of infeed for load flow exchange. Not used for short circuit modeling.  If maxQ and minQ are not used ReactiveCapabilityCurve can be used. Default: 0.0

contents.name: minP
contents.comment: Minimum active power of the injection. Default: 0.0

contents.name: minQ
contents.comment: Used for modeling of infeed for load flow exchange. Not used for short circuit modeling.  If maxQ and minQ are not used ReactiveCapabilityCurve can be used. Default: 0.0

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: p
contents.comment: Equivalent active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for steady state solutions. Default: 0.0

contents.name: q
contents.comment: Equivalent reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for steady state solutions. Default: 0.0

contents.name: r
contents.comment: Positive sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909). Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange. Default: 0.0

contents.name: r0
contents.comment: Zero sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909). Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange. Default: 0.0

contents.name: r2
contents.comment: Negative sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909). Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange. Default: 0.0

contents.name: regulationCapability
contents.comment: Specifies whether or not the EquivalentInjection has the capability to regulate the local voltage. Default: False

contents.name: regulationStatus
contents.comment: Specifies the default regulation status of the EquivalentInjection.  True is regulating.  False is not regulating. Default: False

contents.name: regulationTarget
contents.comment: The target voltage for voltage regulation. Default: 0.0

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: x
contents.comment: Positive sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909). Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange. Default: 0.0

contents.name: x0
contents.comment: Zero sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909). Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange. Default: 0.0

contents.name: x2
contents.comment: Negative sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909). Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange. Default: 0.0

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
